_header: Of this matter to you most clear
_description: Alchemical verses on the Exposition of Earth of Earth — in couplets

BodAsh759.First Lines:
Nowe of this matter to you most clereAn exposicoun I do make
                    here…
BodAsh759.Last Lines:
…His grace to vs therwith he leveTo sawles helth vs to
                    meve
BodAsh759.Attributed Title:
Here folowith thexposicoun of erth of erth is (f.
                    128v)
BodAsh759.Editions:
Ashmole,  Elias. 
             Theatrum Chemicum Britannicum.
         London: J. Grimond, 1652: 428-30.

BodAsh1441.First Lines:
Of this matter darke & nothinge clerea playne descripsion I do
                    make here…
BodAsh1441.Last Lines:
…which is our tincture & our sulphur [viue?]the soule of
                    Saturne & the gold of life

BodAsh1450.First Lines:
Of this matter to you moste clearean exposicion I do make
                    here…
BodAsh1450.Last Lines:
…his grace therwith he vs geveto soules healthe vs to
                    meve
BodAsh1450.Note: 69 lines; immediately follows 5095 as if part of same work.

BodAsh1487.First Lines:
Nowe of this matter to you moste
                    cleerean exposition I do make heere…
BodAsh1487.Last Lines:
…His grace to vs therwithe he leaueTo our soules healthe vs to
                    meave

BodAsh1492.First Lines:
of this matter to you most cleereAn Exposition I doe make
                    heere…
BodAsh1492.Last Lines:
…His Grace therewith he vs giueTo Soules health vs to
                    moue
BodAsh1492.Note: 69 lines; immediately follows 5095 as if part of same work.

                    move

CamTCC925.First Lines:
Of this matter to you most dereAn exposition I doo make
                    here…
CamTCC925.Last Lines:
…His grace with us therwith he lefteTo soules healthe us to
                    meve
CamTCC925.Note:
Written by hand of the sixteenth century; immedietely follows 5095 as if part of same work, and
                    followed by 5113.

Of this matter to you moste clerean Exposityon I doe make

BLSl3667.First Lines:
Of this matter darke & nothyng clereA playne exposicion I do
                    mak here…
BLSl3667.Last Lines:

                    meue

YaleBeiOsfa16.First Lines:
Off this matter to you most cle[re]an exposition I will make
                    heareWherin I chardge you secret to bethat frend ne foo do yt
                    see…
YaleBeiOsfa16.Last Lines:
…his grace wyth vs praye hym to leaveto soules health vs to
                    meve

PhilUPSmith4.First Lines:
Of this mater darke & nothinge clyerplayne discription I do
                    make heare…
PhilUPSmith4.Last Lines:
…There is a body & a ody & a soule & a spiriteWith
                    ayer & fyer muste be knitte

CopenRoy3500.First Lines:
of this matter darke and nothing clee[r]a playne exposicion I do
                    make here…
CopenRoy3500.Last Lines:
…now thanked be god most graciouswhich hath this secrett lente
                    to us
